definitions.title: detested thing
definitions.body: ;—abs. [[שִׁקּוּץ]] Da 11:31, Da 12:11, cstr. [[שִׁקֻּץ]] 1Ki 11:5 +; pl. [[שִׁקּוּחִים]] 2Ch 15:8, [[שִׁקֻּחִים]] 2Ki 23:24; cstr. [[שִׁקּוּחֵי]] Ez Eze 20:7, Eze 20:8; sf. [[שִׁקּוּחֵיהֶם]] Je 16:18+, etc.;—detested thing, epith. of Isr. Ho 9:10 (si vera l.; not elsewhere bef. Dt); of fifth Na 3:6; appar. of unclean food Zec 9:7 (as [[שֶׁקֶץ]]); of idols (so usu.; oft. ‖[[תּוֹעֵבָה ]], [[גִּלּוּל]], etc.), De 29:16, 2Ki 23:24, Je 4:1, Je 7:30 = Je 32:34, Je 13:27, Je 16:18, Ez Eze 5:11, Eze 7:30, Eze 11:18, Eze 11:20, Eze 20:7, Eze 20:8, Eze 20:30, Eze 37:23; of idolatrous practices Da 9:27, but rd.prob.as Da 11:31 (so LXX q), and [[כַגּוֹ]] for [[כנף]] (v. Dr); [[שׁׂמֵם]]([[מְ]]) ´[[שׁ]]: Da 11:31, Da 12:11 destested thing causing horror is the heathen altar erected in temple by Ant. Epiph., with (prob.) a statue of Zeus Olympios = (Ph.) [[בלְשמם]] lord of heaven; the prophet puts [[שִׁקּוּץ]] for [[בעל]], and [[שׁׂמֵם]]([[מְ]]) for [[שָׁמַיִם]]; cf. Nes:ZAW iv (1884), 248 Che:OP 103 Dr:Dn.
